column1: 2021-03-05 22:33:47#business#Elon Musk Loses $27 Billion as Historic Wealth Gains Unravel#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/musk-historic-wealth-gains-unravel-223347255.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/VwsKwgWDuhnzSXJavM7n1A--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD0xMzM0/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/5LW5ZkoYKa2l2cHYB_S3QA--~B/aD0xNDY3O3c9MjIwMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_markets_842/4c093ae67bff2819ce21d259c8fbf3d4#sw#0.5106#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- Elon Musk set records last year for one of the fastest streaks of wealth accumulation in history.  The reversal is underway
column2: and it’s steep. The Tesla Inc.  chief executive officer lost $27 billion since Monday as shares of the automaker tumbled in the selloff of tech stocks.  His $156. 9 billion net worth still places him No.  2 on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index
column3: but he’s now almost $20 billion behind Jeff Bezos
column4: who he topped just last week as world’s richest person. Musk’s tumble only underscores the hard-to-fathom velocity of his ascent.  Tesla shares soared 743% in 2020
column5: boosting the value of his stake and unlocking billions of dollars in options through his historic “moonshot” compensation package. His gains accelerated into the new year.  In January
column6: he unseated Bezos as the world’s richest person.  Musk’s fortune peaked later that month at $210 billion
column8: a ranking of the world’s 500 wealthiest people. Consistent quarterly profits
column9: the election of President Joe Biden with his embrace of clean technologies and enthusiasm from retail investors fueled the company’s rise
column10: but for some
column11: its swelling valuation was emblematic of an unsustainable frothiness in tech.  The Nasdaq 100 Index fell for the third straight week on Friday
column12: its longest streak of declines since September. Bitcoin InvestmentMusk’s fortune hasn’t been solely subject to the forces buffeting the tech industry.  His net worth has risen and slumped recently in tandem with the price of Bitcoin.  Tesla disclosed last month it had added $1. 5 billion of the cryptocurrency to its balance sheet.  Musk’s fortune took a $15 billion hit two weeks later after he mused on twitter that the prices of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies “do seem high. ”Extreme volatility has roiled many of the world’s biggest fortunes this year.  Asia’s once-richest person
column13: Chinese bottled-water tycoon Zhong Shanshan
column14: relinquished the title to Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani last month after losing more than $22 billion in a matter of days. Read more: Ambani Again Richest Asian as China’s Zhong Down $22 BillionQuicken Loans Inc.  Chairman Dan Gilbert’s net worth surged by $25 billion on Monday after his mortgage lender Rocket Cos.  was said to be the next target of Reddit day traders.  His fortune has since fallen by almost $24 billion.  Alphabet Inc.  co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page are among the biggest gainers on the index this year.  They’ve each added more than $13 billion to their fortunes since Jan.  1. For more articles like this
column15: please visit us at bloomberg. comSubscribe now to stay ahead with the most trusted business news source. ©2021 Bloomberg L. P. ##https://finance.yahoo.com/news/musk-historic-wealth-gains-unravel-223347255.html

2021-03-03 08:14:40#business#OPEC+ Is Poised to Cool Oil Market With Extra Production#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/opec-poised-cool-down-oil-190820767.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/onoQCr0dRBo6L0PplnpqIw--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD0xMzM0/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/czSNU3MJvl65mca1DCK86g--~B/aD0yNjY3O3c9NDAwMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_markets_842/9fba6921b8982a3fb04028aaa0de9b83#sw#0.5106#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- OPEC+ is poised to agree a production increase this week as it seeks to cool a rapid rally in crude prices. There’s a widespread view within the group that the market can absorb additional barrels
column2: according to people familiar with the deliberations.  While the usual differences are present -- with Saudi Arabia cautious and Russia keen to open the taps -- all sides are ready to increase production
column3: they said
column4: asking not to be named because the information was private. That could put the group on track to implement the majority of the 1. 5 million barrel-a-day output increase that’s up for debate on Thursday. An agreement to hike OPEC+ supply would be the latest sign that the global economy is recovering from the damage wrought by the coronavirus pandemic.  The cartel has endured a year of pain
column5: dominated by the deepest output cuts in its history.  But the sacrifice has paid off
column6: reviving oil prices back to pre-crisis levels above $60 a barrel. Brent crude rose 0. 3% to $62. 89 a barrel as of 7:54 a. m.  in London.  The international benchmark has surged more than 20% this year. “Both the global economic outlook and oil market prospects show signs of continued improvement
column7: ” OPEC Secretary-General Mohammad Barkindo said at the opening of a meeting of the group’s technical experts on Tuesday.  “The headwinds of uncertainty that shocked and disrupted the market last year continue to abate. ”There are two distinct elements to the production increase that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries and it allies will debate this week. First
column8: will the cartel proceed with a 500
column9: 000 barrel-a-day collective output hike in April? Second
column10: how will Saudi Arabia phase out the extra supply reduction of 1 million barrels a day it’s been making voluntarily in February and March?Robust DemandRussia has been the most consistent advocate for the 500
column11: 000 barrel-a-day increase
column12: and other members now largely agree that it should go ahead
column13: according to people familiar with the matter. The top oil executive from the United Arab Emirates
column14: which has also supported output hikes at recent OPEC+ meetings
column15: gave a bullish assessment of the market on Tuesday. “Oil demand is robust
column16: ” Sultan Al Jaber
column17: the chief executive officer of Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.
column18: said at the IHS Markit Ltd.  CERAWeek virtual conference.  “Demand will rise to above pre-Covid levels by the end of this year. ”Adnoc has already signaled it’s preparing to open the taps
column19: allocating customers greater volumes of Murban
column20: Das and Upper Zakum crudes for April compared with March. Saudi ChoiceSaudi Arabia always said that its voluntary supply reduction would only last for two months
column21: but seasoned OPEC-watchers have suggested that Riyadh could phase it out gradually. The kingdom will start to roll back its extra cut as planned in April
column22: but is still discussing internally whether to return all of the barrels in a single month
column23: or over a longer period
column24: said people familiar with the deliberations.  The decision will take into account the commissioning of the new 400
column25: 000 barrel-a-day Jizan refinery
column26: which could affect both domestic crude consumption and exports
column27: they said. At CERAWeek
column28: Saudi Aramco CEO Amin Nasser struck a more cautious tone than his counterpart from the UAE
column29: predicting strong demand in the second half of 2021
column30: and a return to pre-Covid consumption next year. Remarkable ComebackWhatever the Saudis decide
column31: the global oil market is poised to receive its biggest supply boost since August
column32: when OPEC+ first began the process of tapering the 9. 7 million barrel-a-day cut agreed in April last year as the pandemic crushed demand. The group appears to think the market is ready for it.  Even if OPEC+ boosts production by 2. 4 million barrels a day between February and June -- the maximum amount allowed under the current deal -- it will still be able to clear the remnants of the 2020 supply glut by August
column33: the secretariat’s analysts predicted on Tuesday. Achieving that would be a remarkable comeback from one of the biggest crises in the cartel’s history.  It’s almost exactly a year since a disagreement between Russia and Saudi Arabia over how to respond to the early stages of the pandemic triggered a monthlong price war.  The group flooded the market just as demand plunged
column34: a disastrous decision that pushed crude prices below zero for the first time in history.  Twelve months later
column35: fuel stockpiles in industrialized countries aren’t far off target levels and crude prices are close to break-even for some members
column36: presenting “the perfect opportunity for OPEC+ to raise production
column37: ” analysts at Australia & New Zealand Banking Group Ltd.  said in a note.  (Updates with oil price in fifth paragraph. )For more articles like this
column38: please visit us at bloomberg. comSubscribe now to stay ahead with the most trusted business news source. ©2021 Bloomberg L. P. ##https://finance.yahoo.com/news/opec-poised-cool-down-oil-190820767.html

column1: 2021-02-24 12:46:54#tech#Gorgeous Moebius-inspired roguelike PixelJunk Raiders is a Stadia exclusive#https://www.pcgamer.com/gorgeous-moebius-inspired-roguelike-pixeljunk-raiders-is-a-stadia-exclusive/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/wfMLba5NMpD6tgFkgSkoHZ-1200-80.jpg#sw#0.6705#www.pcgamer.com#PixelJunk Raiders
column2: the next game from developer Q-Games
column3: looks stunning.  A 70s pulp sci-fi adventure oozing with vibrant landscapes
column4: weird monsters
column5: and a synth-tastic score.  A shame
column7: that it'll launch exclusively on Google Stadia when it arrives next month. The next entry in the developer's long line of PixelJunk games
column8: Raiders is a third-person action roguelike that sees you awake from a long slumber into a world of aliens
column9: monsters
column10: and anomalous mysteries.  Like the gorgeous Sable
column11: Raiders is also sporting some serious Moebius vibes.  Frankly
column12: I'm ready for more games that look like they were pulled off prog-rock album covers.  Sadly
column13: Raiders is launching as a Stadia exclusive—and now isn't a great time to be selling solely via Google's streaming service.  Stadia recently shuttered its internal development studios
column14: raising serious questions about the long-term future of the project
column15: while first-party Stadia game Journey To The Savage Planet has been left in limbo with nobody around to fix its bugs. A Google blog post notes that Raiders is built to take advantage of Stadia tricks like State Share
column16: which lets you pick up where another player left off by grabbing their game-state via screenshot or video.  The game will also be free to play for Stadia Pro subscribers. But a few neat tricks might not be enough to convince folks to finally jump on board with Stadia at this point in time.  Let's hope for a proper PC release somewhere down the road—it'd be a shame to see a game this slick languish on a declining platform. ##https://www.pcgamer.com/gorgeous-moebius-inspired-roguelike-pixeljunk-raiders-is-a-stadia-exclusive/

column1: 2021-02-09 00:20:47#tech#Valheim is making me love survival games again#https://www.pcgamer.com/valheim-is-making-me-love-survival-games-again/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/CtYGQR7nUa4HD4FAusKTrJ-1200-80.jpg#sw#0.6369#www.pcgamer.com#I'm 25 hours into Valheim when I finally climb aboard my raft and cross the sea for the first time.  It's a tense journey.  As I slowly bob over the waves on my vulnerable little square of logs
column2: the land gradually fades away behind me and all I can see is the ocean.  Night falls and fog rolls in
column3: leaving me to peer through the inky darkness for some sign of land that may not even be there. I've seen video of sea monsters.  I know there are new biomes I'm not ready to face yet.  I stupidly didn't pack much food.  As I travel through the night I completely regret leaving my cozy little fort behind. I finally reach another landmass and step off my raft
column4: relieved to have survived the slow
column5: uneventful
column6: but completely harrowing journey.  I slap together a tiny building and construct a portal
column7: which allows me to teleport back to my main base.  Even though absolutely nothing happened on my voyage I don't think I've ever felt such relief to return home.  It's a tiny step I just took
column8: extending myself across the ocean to establish a new base
column9: but for a Viking who spends most of his time hunting deer
column10: keeping bees
column11: and farming carrots
column12: it feels like a brave
column13: bold leap. Valheim is good.  And it's rekindled my love of survival games. I used to play a lot of survival.  Minecraft
column14: DayZ
column15: Ark: Survival Evolved
column16: Starbound
column17: The Forest
column18: Green Hell
column19: Miscreated
column20: and lots of others.  But at some point I just lost my passion for them.  Most began to feel very similar: start with nothing
column21: pick up a rock
column22: grab a stick
column23: and you've got yourself a stone axe.  Then just murder trees for the next 75 straight hours.  Chopping down trees became one of my least favorite things to do
column24: so much that I ranked tree-chopping in survival games from worst to least-worst. But here's Valheim
column25: the co-op Viking survival game
column26: and I'm loving it all again—even though I'm still spending great gobs of time chopping down trees.  It didn't happen immediately—as I wrote earlier this week
column27: at first Valheim felt like a very standard survival experience.  But the more I played
column28: the more I loved it.  It does a lot of things right. ##https://www.pcgamer.com/valheim-is-making-me-love-survival-games-again/

column1: 2021-02-08 13:30:00#business#Cassava Sciences Announces Significant Program Progress and Expected Key Milestones in 2021 for Its Clinical Program in Alzheimer’s Disease#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cassava-sciences-announces-significant-program-133000617.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/9hV1Gm0Pd5rGJ5915uWdRQ--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD02NTU-/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/v7mQlD0EWQQq3I1jCJQsig--~B/aD04MzY7dz0yNTUxO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/globenewswire.com/4bd921df950e87853a72069e7b7c3279#sw#0.5574#finance.yahoo.com#AUSTIN
column2: Texas
column3: Feb.  08
column4: 2021 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Cassava Sciences
column5: Inc.  (Nasdaq: SAVA)
column6: a clinical-stage biotechnology company developing product candidates for Alzheimer’s disease
column7: today announced significant program progress and expected milestones for 2021.  “We started 2021 with tremendous momentum
column8: led by results of a 6-month interim analysis from an open-label study of simufilam
column9: our drug candidate for Alzheimer’s disease
column10: ” said Remi Barbier
column11: President & CEO.  “I believe the rest of the year may be equally exciting. ” Cassava Sciences’ strategic focus for 2021 is to advance simufilam in a Phase 3 clinical program in Alzheimer’s disease
column12: to expand drug manufacturing capabilities in support of the clinical program
column13: and to continue to lead the Company to deliver the full potential of its product portfolio.  Cassava Sciences’ 2021 Scientific and Clinical OutlookCassava Sciences’ product portfolio includes a small molecule drug for the treatment of Alzheimer’s disease
column14: called simufilam
column15: and an investigational blood-based diagnostic to detect and monitor the progression of Alzheimer’s disease
column16: called SavaDx.  Expected progress and key milestones in 2021 across Cassava Sciences’ product portfolio are summarized below.  Based on recent positive clinical results and inbound demand from clinical sites
column17: patients
column18: and their caregivers
column19: Cassava Sciences plans to expand the size of the ongoing open-label study of simufilam.  The target enrollment will be increased by up to 50 additional patients with mild-to-moderate Alzheimer’s disease
column20: for a total target enrollment of up to 150 patients.  Cassava Sciences has enrolled approximately 80 patients in the open-label study to date.  To accommodate increased enrollment
column21: the Company plans to open new clinical sites across the U. S.  and Canada.  Cassava Sciences expects to announce results of a second interim analysis of the ongoing open-label study when approximately 50 patients complete 12 months of drug treatment.  This second interim analysis is expected to include clinical data around long-term safety
column22: cognition and Alzheimer’s-related behavior. Cassava Sciences plans to initiate a 6-month
column23: double-blind
column24: randomized
column25: placebo-controlled study in patients with Alzheimer’s disease who complete at least one year of open-label treatment with simufilam.  This is a Cognition Maintenance Study (CMS)
column26: in which patients who complete one year of open-label treatment will subsequently be randomized (1:1) to simufilam or placebo for six months.  The CMS is designed to compare simufilam’s effects on cognition and behavior in patients who continue with drug treatment versus those who discontinue drug treatment.  For ethical and other reasons
column27: patients who successfully complete the six-month CMS will have the option to receive open-label simufilam. Cassava Sciences’ clinical and regulatory strategy for simufilam is progressing as planned.  In January 2021
column28: the Company concluded a successful End-of-phase 2 (EOP2) meeting with the U. S Food and Drug Administration (FDA).  The purpose of the EOP2 was to gain general agreement around a Phase 3 program to treat Alzheimer’s disease dementia.  As a result of the EOP2 meeting
column29: Cassava Sciences believes its clinical program for simufilam is green-lighted to commence a large
column30: Phase 3 clinical program in patients with Alzheimer’s disease
column31: pending official FDA meeting minutes of the EOP2 meeting. Cassava Sciences plans to initiate a Phase 3 program of simufilam in Alzheimer’s disease in the second half of 2021.  Cassava Sciences’ Phase 3 program for simufilam consists of two large
column32: double-blind
column33: randomized
column34: placebo-controlled studies of simufilam in patients with mild-to-moderate Alzheimer’s disease dementia.  The Company expects to announce details of its Phase 3 program in Q1 2021
column35: pending official FDA meeting minutes of the EOP2 meeting. Cassava Sciences’ first Phase 3 study will evaluate disease-modifying effects in Alzheimer’s disease patients over 18 months.  The goal of this study is to show a slower rate of decline in cognition and daily function in patients treated with simufilam
column36: compared to patients treated with placebo.  Cassava Sciences’ second Phase 3 study will evaluate symptomatic improvement in Alzheimer’s disease patients over 6 months.  The goal of this study is to show improvement in cognition and daily function in patients treated with simufilam
column37: compared to patients treated with placebo.  Cassava Sciences believes its manufacturing strategy is on-track to ensure sufficient drug supply for a Phase 3 program
column38: including both drug substance (i. e.
column39: active ingredient) and drug product (i. e.
column40: oral tablets). Cassava Sciences expects to conclude a long-term
column41: commercial drug supply agreement for simufilam with a contract manufacturing organization.  The goal is to ensure the integrity of the drug supply chain on a worldwide basis
column42: in compliance with FDA standards.  Cassava Sciences expects to initiate a validation study with SavaDx
column43: its investigational diagnostic for the detection of Alzheimer’s disease. Cassava Sciences is in discussions with scientific and clinical advisors about potentially expanding therapeutic indications for simufilam outside of Alzheimer’s disease
column44: but still within neurodegenerative conditions.  Other Expected Milestones and Announcements for 2021 Cassava Sciences expects to announce publication of Phase 2b results in a peer-reviewed technical journal. Net cash use for full-year 2021 is expected to be in the range of $20 to $25 million
column45: depending on enrollment rates in its clinical programs and other factors.  On December 31
column47: unaudited cash and cash equivalents were approximately $93 million.  Slide DeckA copy of Cassava Sciences’ latest corporate presentation is available on its website https://www. CassavaSciences. com
column48: under the Investors/Presentations page.  About Alzheimer's Disease Alzheimer’s disease is a progressive brain disorder that destroys memory and thinking skills.  Currently
column49: there are no drug therapies to halt Alzheimer’s disease
column50: much less reverse its course.  In the U. S.  alone
column51: approximately 5. 8 million people are currently living with Alzheimer’s disease
column52: and approximately 487
column53: 000 people age 65 or older developed Alzheimer’s in 2019. 1 The number of people living with Alzheimer’s disease is expected to grow dramatically in the years ahead
column54: resulting in a growing social and economic burden. 2 About SimufilamSimufilam is a proprietary
column55: small molecule (oral) drug that restores the normal shape and function of altered filamin A (FLNA)
column56: a scaffolding protein
column57: in the brain.  Altered FLNA in the brain disrupts the normal function of neurons
column58: leading to Alzheimer’s pathology
column59: neurodegeneration and neuroinflammation.  The underlying science for simufilam is published in peer-reviewed journals
column60: including Journal of Neuroscience
column61: Neurobiology of Aging
column62: Journal of Biological Chemistry
column63: Neuroimmunology and Neuroinflammation and Journal of Prevention of Alzheimer’s Disease.  Cassava Sciences is also developing an investigational diagnostic
column64: called SavaDx
column65: to detect Alzheimer’s disease with a simple blood test. Simufilam and SavaDx were both developed in-house.  Both product candidates are substantially funded by peer-review research grant awards from the National Institutes of Health (NIH).  Cassava Sciences owns worldwide development and commercial rights to its research programs in Alzheimer’s disease
column66: and related technologies
column67: without royalty obligations to any third party.  About Cassava Sciences
column68: Inc. Cassava Sciences’ mission is to discover and develop innovations for chronic
column69: neurodegenerative conditions.  Over the past 10 years
column70: Cassava Sciences has combined state-of-the-art technology with new insights in neurobiology to develop novel solutions for Alzheimer’s disease.  For more information
column71: please visit: https://www. CassavaSciences. com For More Information Contact:Eric Schoen
column72: Chief Financial Officereschoen@CassavaSciences. com(512) 501-2450 Cassava Sciences’ open-label study of simufilam in Alzheimer’s disease is funded by clinical research grant AG065152 from the National Institutes of Health (NIH/NIA).  The content of this press release is solely the responsibility of Cassava Sciences and does not necessarily represent the official views of the NIH/NIA.  Cassava Sciences Safe HarborThis news release contains forward-looking statements
column73: including statements made pursuant to the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995
column74: relating to: our strategy and plans; the treatment of Alzheimer’s disease; the status of current and future clinical studies with simufilam
column75: including the interpretation of an interim analysis of open-label study results; planned enrollment and other changes to the open-label program; our intention to initiate a Phase 3 clinical program with simufilam in 2nd half 2021; results of our EOP2 meeting with FDA and the timing of further announcements; our ability to manufacture drug supply for a Phase 3 program and to enter into a long-term commercial drug supply agreement; the timing of validation studies with SavaDx; our ability to expand therapeutic indications for simufilam outside of Alzheimer’s disease; expected cash use in future periods; plans to publish results of a Phase 2b study in a peer-reviewed journal; verbal commentaries made by our employees; and potential benefits
column77: of the our product candidates.  These statements may be identified by words such as “may
column87: ” and other words and terms of similar meaning.  Drug development and commercialization involve a high degree of risk
column88: and only a small number of research and development programs result in commercialization of a product.  Our clinical results from earlier-stage clinical trials may not be indicative of full results or results from later-stage or larger scale clinical trials and do not ensure regulatory approval.  You should not place undue reliance on these statements or any scientific data we present or publish.  Such statements are based largely on our current expectations and projections about future events.  Such statements speak only as of the date of this news release and are subject to a number of risks

State FarmLive sporting events are among the few remaining places where advertisers can ensure that no one fast forwards through their commercials which is why companies were willing to pay US$5. 5 million for just 30 seconds of air time on Super Bowl Sunday.  So who “won” the Super Bowl ad war? For the last two years
column4: I have been using the Adam Brown Social Media Command Center at the University of Tennessee to understand how social media like Twitter and Facebook react to major events such as presidential debates
column5: breaking news like the GameStop craze and sporting events like the Super Bowl.  Engagement on Twitter is one measure companies use to determine an advertisement’s success and whether it was worth all those millions – not to mention the cost of making Super Bowl ads
column6: which often include celebrities.  Here’s what I noticed from monitoring social media during Super Bowl LV.  The performers I didn’t monitor the game itself – in which Tom Brady led the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to a 31-9 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs.  But I did notice the performers
column7: including the first poet to ever present at a Super Bowl
column8: received a lot of buzz.  The Weeknd’s halftime performance – and his closeup – was the talk of Twitter
column9: as Super Bowl performances usually are.  With his prime time slot and greatest hits montage
column10: he was the biggest hit on social media
column11: with over 821
column12: 000 mentions during the game
column13: most of which were quite positive.  Poet Amanda Gorman
column14: who gained national recognition at President Joe Biden’s inauguration
column15: received almost 60
column16: 000 mentions that were overwhelmingly positive after she read a poem during the pre-game show.  Amanda Gorman recites ‘Chorus of the Captains. ’ Drake
column17: Disney and Dew Of the dozens of companies that bought ad time during the big game
column18: three won the Twitterverse with the most positively talked about advertisements of the evening.  I reached that conclusion by analyzing the volume of tweets that mentioned the company or used a hashtag introduced in the commercial
column19: as well as by examining the sentiment score to see whether the conversation around the ads was positive or negative.  One of the big winners was State Farm’s ads starring Drake
column20: in which the rapper appears as a stand-in for “Jake
column21: ” who has appeared frequently in the insurer’s advertisements.  Over 28
column22: 000 tweets mentioned State Farm within 40 minutes of the commercial’s first airing
column23: for a total of 44
column24: 000 during the game.  “Drake” was a keyword in most of them.  Sentiment was very positive for most of the night as people found “Drake from State Farm” funny
column25: until some users brought up the “Drake curse” that is supposedly bad luck for sports teams.  ‘Drake from State Farm. ’ Disney’s trailer for its upcoming series “The Falcon and The Winter Soldier” performed even better
column26: spurring over 100
column27: 000 tweets that specifically mentioned the show.  Sentiment was also overwhelmingly positive for the show which stars two characters from the Marvel universe
column28: with a score of over 90% throughout the evening.  Mountain Dew’s ad featuring pro wrestler John Cena driving through a “surreal watermelon-themed amusement park” won the evening on social media.  It received over 300
column29: 000 mentions
column30: likely driven by the $1 million offered to the first person who tweeted out the correct number of “major melon” bottles that appeared in the ad.  Mountain Dew’s million-dollar giveaway.  A few duds Super Bowl mainstay Budweiser had a pretty bad night.  At first it said it would not buy advertising this year and instead donate the money to coronavirus vaccination awareness efforts.  But apparently it changed its mind and ran several ads for Bud Light and Bud Light Seltzer.  Mentions of the two beers were under 10
column31: 000 and sentiment turned negative after the ads began running.  Shift4Shop
column32: an e-commerce platform
column33: advertised its partnership with the Inspiration4 civilian mission to space.  The ad did not appear to leave much of an impact on Twitter users
column34: however
column35: with fewer than 2
column36: 000 tweets during the game – not much of an effect for the price tag.  It reminded me of Quibi’s Super Bowl ad last year which was meant to be the TV streaming app’s debut to the world.  It was not well-received
column37: and the company called it quits in December.  Another big loser were advertisements that were “heavy” – ad jargon for commercials that are overly emotive
column38: such as those referencing weighty events like the pandemic or the Capitol riots.  Most Super Bowl advertisers avoided these themes – opting instead for escapism and nostalgia.  And the ones that did go heavy didn’t do well
column39: such as Bass Pro Shops and Cabela’s ad
column40: during which the narrator intoned that “in these trying times we need nature more than ever. ” Jeep’s ad starring Bruce Springsteen garnered a lot of attention – 20
column41: 000 tweets within minutes of its airing after half time – but most of it negative.  Over two minutes
column42: the Boss implores Americans to “meet in the middle” in a call for unity that some Twitter users described as “tone deaf. ” Too political? Honorable mention While it didn’t break the internet
column43: vegan food company Oatly’s love-it-or-hate-it ad got a fair amount of attention given how minimilistic it was.  It featured the company’s CEO playing piano in a field and singing about Oatly’s products.  People seemed evenly split on whether the ad was good or absolutely horrible – but it did generate over 16
column44: 000 tweets.  The negative reaction may have been the company’s plan all along as it immediately began selling T-shirts saying
column45: “I totally hated that Oatly commercial. ” The shirts sold out in five minutes.  [You’re too busy to read everything.  We get it.  That’s why we’ve got a weekly newsletter.  Sign up for good Sunday reading.  ]This article is republished from The Conversation

column4: which had been widely expected

column11: from Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.  and Yahoo! two decades ago

The Tokyo-based company had a net income of 1. 17 trillion yen in the December period and did not release operating profit figures.  At least six more portfolio companies are planning IPOs this year. “There is a lot of liquidity out there and investors are particularly partial toward tech stocks

column26: the Japan telecommunications unit.  SoftBank also announced a deal to sell its chip designer Arm Ltd.  to Nvidia Corp.  for $40 billion. SoftBank held a total of $22 billion of “highly liquid listed stocks” as of the end of quarter
column27: including a $7. 39 billion investment in Amazon. com Inc.
column28: $3. 28 billion in Facebook Inc.  and $1. 38 billion in Alphabet Inc.  The operation is managed by its asset management subsidiary SB Northstar
column29: where Son personally holds a 33% stake. The investments were accompanied by derivatives that amplified exposure
column30: but SoftBank has been winding down its options strategy amid a backlash from investors.  The fair value of SoftBank’s futures and options positions came to little over $1 billion at the end of December
column31: compared with $2. 7 billion the previous quarter.  Long call options on listed stocks have dwindled to $1. 68 billion from $4. 69 billion and short call options on listed stocks declined to $238 million from $1. 26 billion of value. Son said that the losses in the asset management arm have swung to a profit of about 100 billion yen since the end of last quarter.  But the operations remain in a “test-drive stage
column32: ” he said. Alibaba
column33: Son’s most stark investment success to date and SoftBank’s largest asset
column34: saw its shares plunge about 20% last quarter amid a Chinese government clampdown that scuttled the planned listing of its affiliate Ant Group Co.  Founder Jack Ma had all but vanished from public view
column35: prompting investor unease before he resurfaced last month. Son said he remained in touch with Ma
column36: without giving specific details of their communications.  He said Ma likes to draw and shares his drawings with Son via chat; the SoftBank chief also sketches but hasn’t shared any of his work.  Son also said he saw the increased antitrust scrutiny of Ma’s businesses in China as part of the country’s natural evolution. SoftBank’s own sale of Arm to Nvidia is still making its way through the approval process gauntlet.  The United Kingdom and European Union are both preparing to launch probes into the deal
column37: the Financial Times reported last week.  Son said he remained confident that it will receive a green light at the end. SoftBank has also joined the blank-check company frenzy with plans for several special purpose acquisition companies.  SVF Investment Corp.  raised $525 million last month to address sectors like mobile communications technology
column38: artificial intelligence
column39: robotics
column40: cloud technologies and software.  LDH Growth Corp I plans to raise as much as $200 million to target Latin American and Hispanic markets. SoftBank last week filed for two more SPACs
column41: seeking to raise another $630 million.  The new SoftBank vehicles
column42: SVF Investment Corp.  2 and 3
column43: will target the same diverse areas of technology as the first
column44: including mobile communications and artificial intelligence
column45: according to filings Friday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. “Consistently good performance by Vision Fund portfolio companies also helps the SPAC’s prospects because investors can extrapolate management expertise
column46: ” said Tang at United First Partners.  “It underlines their skill in deploying capital. ”SoftBank may see between 10 to 20 public listings a year from its portfolio of 164 startups across three different funds
column47: Son said.  A typical early-stage venture capital fund might see a third of its bets pay off
column48: but SoftBank’s portfolio of late-stage companies should do better than that
column49: he said.  Even WeWork has received SPAC interest
column50: he said. The billionaire struck a tone that was reminiscent of the days before the WeWork fiasco in late 2019.  He said the key to turning “white egg” investments into golden egg hits was “turbo-charging” startups with “overwhelming capital
column51: ” more ambitious goals and synergies with other portfolio companies. Son’s presentation then took a turn for the comical.  He flipped to an animated slide of a goose tagged with “AI revolution” text and a line of golden eggs marching out of its backside to Tchaikovsky’s Nutcracker. “Investment is a rhythm
column52: ” Son said.  “But please don’t look at this too seriously. ”(Updates with Son’s comments on Alibaba

column1: 2021-01-26 09:00:28#business#From Pony Ma to Jack Ma
column2: the Rich Win Big With Wild H.K. Stocks#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/pony-ma-jack-ma-rich-025519828.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/P.8uRoHaCrprehjNGYKIxA--~B/aD04NDg7dz0xMjk2O2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_technology_68/6c819f75b6356b427b21008a1d6fd7b8#sw#0.8126#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- Pony Ma got $6. 9 billion richer on Monday after one of the companies his Tencent Holdings Ltd.  backs revealed its IPO plans
column3: while Jack Ma’s public reappearance Wednesday added $1. 6 billion to his net worth. Even though the Hong Kong market has proved particularly volatile lately -- the benchmark Hang Seng Index gave up all of of its Monday gain on Tuesday -- it’s been one of the world’s highlights this month. Tencent and Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.
column4: along with food-delivery giant Meituan and carmaker Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd.
column5: were among the stocks helping propel the rally.  Their top executives have made a combined $32 billion this month through Monday
column6: and they’re not the only ones benefiting
column7: according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The Top 10 richest moguls with companies that have a primary listing in Hong Kong have added more than $60 billion of wealth in January -- or $3. 8 billion for each trading day.  This doesn’t include Jack Ma
column8: whose Alibaba trades in Hong Kong but has its primary listing is in New York.  His net worth is up $3. 5 billion this month to $54. 1 billion as he resurfaced in a video after weeks of speculation about his whereabouts following a Chinese government clampdown that had left his business empire in crisis. Read more: Jack Ma’s Video Chat Prompts a $58 Billion Sigh of ReliefEven China Evergrande Group’s Hui Ka Yan
column9: whose net worth sank more than anyone elese’s in Asia last year
column10: has regained $2. 6 billion in 2021.  His electric-vehicle startup said Sunday it’s selling HK$26 billion ($3. 35 billion) of shares
column11: triggering a 52% surge in the stock. While Hong Kong’s economy got badly hit from the coronavirus crisis and a political crackdown
column12: money has kept flowing to the city.  Mainlanders taking advantage of bargain prices after international investors were forced to dump some newly banned Chinese stocks have helped boost the market
column13: just as concerns over stricter regulatory rules governing internet giants in China have eased.  At the same time
column14: companies linked to Chinese consumers -- like Meituan -- have benefited as the nation was one of the few able to control the Covid-19 pandemic and the government has pledged to increase consumption. The Hang Seng Index soared 11% in January through Monday
column15: when it hit its highest level since June 2018.  It fell 2. 6% on Tuesday. Pony Ma’s $18. 6 billion wealth surge this month is the biggest after Elon Musk’s
column16: while Tencent co-founder Zhang Zhidong has gained $8. 5 billion.  Zhong Shanshan of bottled-water maker Nongfu Spring Co.
column17: who became Asia’s richest person at the end of 2020 and started the year by taking Warren Buffett’s spot as the world’s sixth wealthiest
column18: has added $16. 2 billion in 2021.  Meituan’s Wang Xing has amassed $7. 8 billion. Xiaomi Corp. ’s Lei Jun is the only major tycoon whose net worth has dropped in January.  The U. S.  blacklisted the smartphone maker in an unexpected move that sank its shares a record 10% on Jan.  15. (Updates for market move in second

The smart glasses maker has been on a roll with shares up by a massive 518% over the past 12 months.  However
column3: Maxim analyst Jack Vander Aarde thinks there’s more to come.  The 5-star analyst expects 2021 to “mark a significant growth inflection point. ” Vander Aarde rests his bullish thesis on several factors.  First off
column4: the company just released a positive Q4 preliminary update.  The company anticipates 4Q20 revenue of over $4 million
column5: representing more than a 100% year-over-year uptick.  Following the update
column6: the analyst raised his Q4 revenue estimate from $3. 8 million to a matching $4 million.  Furthermore
column8: the company’s balance sheet has been given a boost with the addition of $28. 6 million
column9: following the triggering of nearly 6 million warrant exercises.  The company is also being recognized by the industry; its Next Generation Smart Glasses (NGSG) recently received 3 CES 2021 awards.  Most important of all
column10: however
column11: Vuzix keeps announcing an “increasing number of positive updates regarding product launches
column12: new customers and new market verticals
column13: and product applications. ” On Wednesday
column14: the company announced a collaboration with virtual care company Hippo Technologies
column15: and earlier this month
column16: medical technology company BioSig Technologies
column17: said it plans to use Vuzix's smart glasses to remotely service some of its devices.  The January wins follow a plethora of new customer additions in December.  The list includes Pixee Medical
column18: European resellers
column19: U. S.  general merchandise retailers
column20: and “an undisclosed major international defense contractor. ” The abundance of good news results in a glowing review from Vander Aarde.  “We believe VUZI’s long-term potential will only be limited by sales and marketing investment and further production capacity expansion
column21: which will likely take time to further develop to the scale necessary to capitalize on the massive long-term opportunity
column22: ” the analyst said.  Furthermore
column23: “[We] believe it would be reasonable for VUZI to trade at a premium to peers
column24: based on our view that VUZI is well-positioned for multi-year revenue growth of 100%+ (which we consider rare) and we believe its commercially ready technology and product portfolio is ahead of competitors
column25: which we expect to result in VUZI having dominant share of the nascent and rapidly expanding AR/VR wearables market. ” To this end
column26: Vander Aarde reiterated a Buy rating on VUZI shares
column27: while doubling his price target from $6. 5 to $13.  (To watch Vander Aarde’s track record

column2: carrying a record-breaking number of satellites#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/watch-spacex-launch-first-dedicated-141102174.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/s.o_X6wSBVsHBN9lrG2jZg--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD0xMzMz/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/esKTjyHMniBmUttm16JtMw--~B/aD0yMDAwO3c9MzAwMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/techcrunch_350/663f4effcbea7f93124a74ca46395f8d#sw#0.5106#finance.yahoo.com#SpaceX is set to launch the very first of its dedicated rideshare missions – an offering it introduced in 2019 that allows small satellite operators to book a portion of a payload on a Falcon 9 launch.  SpaceX's rocket has a relatively high payload capacity compared to the size of many of the small satellites produced today
column3: so a rideshare mission like this offers smaller companies and startups a chance to get their spacecraft in orbit without breaking the bank.  The cargo capsule atop the Falcon 9 flying today holds a total of 133 satellites according to SpaceX
column4: which is a new record for the highest number of satellites being launched on a single rocket – beating out a payload of 104 spacecraft delivered by Indian Space Research Organization's PSLV-C37 launch back in February 2017. ##https://finance.yahoo.com/news/watch-spacex-launch-first-dedicated-141102174.html

Shay Horse/NurPhoto via Getty ImagesThe terror inflicted on the U. S.  Capitol on Jan.  6 laid bare America’s problem with violent extremism.  The FBI and other law enforcement agencies have begun to piece together the events of that day
column2: while attempting to thwart any impending attacks.  Scores of people have been arrested and charged over the attack – the vast majority being men.  In the wake of these events
column3: there were stories attributing the violence and destruction to “white male rage” “violent male rage” and “angry white men. ” But what about the women? To distill the violent insurrection into a tale of angry male rage is to overlook the threat that women in the mob posed to congressional officials
column4: law enforcement and U. S.  democracy that day.  Long history of women’s involvement Several women have been identified as alleged participants in the events of Jan.  6.  Among those women are a former school occupational therapist
column5: an employee of a county sheriff’s office
column6: a real estate broker and a former mayoral candidate.  At least one woman is being investigated for her role in organizing the attack with fellow members of the Oath Keepers
column7: a far-right militia movement.  And Ashli Babbit
column8: a female veteran
column9: was shot dead by police while attempting to breach the Senate floor.  The women who took part in the siege of the Capitol are part of a long history of women’s participation in extremist violence
column10: both in the United States and abroad.  Jessica Watkins
column11: seen here in a photo from the Montgomery County jail
column12: is facing federal charges that she participated in the assault on the U. S.  Capitol.  Montgomery County Jail via AP Women have buoyed American far-right organizations and causes for centuries.  In her recent book on women at the forefront of contemporary white nationalism
column13: author Seyward Darby writes that women are not “incidental to white nationalism
column14: they are a sustaining feature. ” Since the late 1800s
column15: women have supported and enabled the terrorist white supremacist organization the Ku Klux Klan
column16: while hundreds of thousands joined its female affiliate
column17: Women of the Ku Klux Klan
column18: and its predecessors.  Women helped establish the Klan’s culture
column19: bolstered its recruitment efforts and manufactured its propaganda.  Despite its hyper-masculine ideology
column20: which identifies white men as the primary arbiters of political power
column21: women have also held leadership positions within the modern-day Klan.  More recently
column22: women have joined the far-right Proud Boys movement
column23: which has openly recruited female foot soldiers.  In December
column24: a growing rift between male and female Proud Boys was reported.  After experiencing intense sexist backlash from men in the organization
column25: women led by MMA fighter Tara LaRosa began their own group
column26: the Proud Girls USA.  To leave one extremist organization in order to form another suggests a deep commitment to the far-right cause.  Discounting is dangerous A 2005 study noted a disconnect between the rise in women within American right-wing terrorist organizations and the attention it received from law enforcement.  Despite a marked increase in women’s engagement in acts of terror against the state and racial minorities
column27: security officials have largely failed to publicize
column28: search and interrogate women operatives in these organizations
column29: even after they become known to law enforcement.  There is also evidence that American far-right women have drawn inspiration and tactical knowledge from women engaged in extremist violence abroad.  Evidence from the global war on terror points to the potential dangers of ignoring the growth of violent extremism among women.  In Iraq
column30: for example
column31: female terrorists carried out large numbers of deadly suicide attacks against American assets during the U. S.  occupation.  The rest of the world has since been forced to grapple with the reality of violent women after female terrorists staged lethal attacks in Nigeria
column32: Somalia
column33: Tunisia
column34: the Philippines
column35: Indonesia and France.  Recent terror attacks in American cities such as San Bernardino
column36: California
column37: and Las Vegas that featured women among the perpetrators confirm violent women have already inflicted damage on U. S.  soil.  Ku Klux Klan security guards escort two female members after a Klan meeting in Castro Valley
column38: California
column39: in 1979.  AP Photo/PS Gender bias can be deadly In fact
column40: my research suggests that attacks by female terrorists are often more destructive than those executed by their male counterparts.  In an analysis of over 2
column41: 500 global suicide attacks
column42: I show disparities in the severity of male and female attacks are greatest where gender stereotypes suggest that women are neither violent nor political.  Such tropes can blind security officials and civilians to the threat posed by women terrorists
column43: causing them to overlook the potential for female complicity.  Female terrorists
column44: including in Iraq
column45: Israel and Nigeria
column46: have been able to deflect suspicion because they were women.  My research shows that gender bias can become deadly when it stops effective counterterrorism policies
column47: such as surveillance
column48: searches and interrogations
column49: from being implemented.  Additionally
column50: since ordinary citizens played an unusual role in exposing the identities of the Capitol attackers
column51: gender biases among civilians are also relevant.  Failure to accept women’s complicity in the Capitol siege and the broader movement may prevent the identification of female offenders and impedes efforts to punish and deter future attacks.  American women have been key pillars of support for violent right-wing extremists for centuries.  They have been right-wing extremists themselves – racist skinheads
column52: neo-Nazis and Klanswomen.  Women are also Oath Keepers
column53: Three Percenters and Proud Boys.  They were capitol rioters.  To construct an accurate account of the Capitol attack
column54: it’s necessary to ask “Where are the women?” And the answer is
column55: “Right there. ”This article is republished from The Conversation

column10: including projects
column11: talent
column12: and more
column13: Cheng said on the Klei forums.  ""There are some boring accounting changes that we will need to adjust to.  Other than that
column14: I will continue running the studio as before
column15: with no changes to staffing
column16: projects or other operations. ""Tencent is China's largest tech conglomerate
column17: and a game industry powerhouse: It owns League of Legends studio Riot Games outright
column18: holds a 40 percent stake in Epic Games
column19: and has smaller stakes in Activision
column20: Ubisoft
column21: Paradox Interacitve
column22: Frontier Developments
column23: Funcom
column24: Fatshark
column25: and many others.  It invested in 31 gaming companies in 2020
column26: and while many were based in China the moves gave the company control over a number of studios that will be familiar to Western gamers.  It acquired Leyou Technology for $1. 5 billion in August 2020
column27: for instance
column28: which owns Warframe developer Digital Extremes and Gears Tactics studio Splash Damage
column29: among others.  The deal means that they are now all owned by Tencent. Despite its massive size
column30: Cheng said that ""Tencent is the only company that we felt would let us retain the level of control that we demand. "" He also noted that Klei has previously worked with Tencent on all of its game releases in China since Don't Starve Together in 2016. ""Players in China make up a large proportion of the players of our games
column31: and we have been supporting them alongside our North American operation for several years
column32: he said.  ""We don’t expect significant operational changes for China or anywhere else in the world
column33: but we do expect that this partnership will help us to better support our players in China. ""A September 2020 report said that after banning the WeChat app
column34: the US government was considering similar action against Tencent.  In January
column35: however

column37: which also included Alibaba and Baidu
column38: had been put on hold.  Klei's latest game
column39: the deck-building roguelite Griftlands

column5: Jeff Bezos

column10: according to Ferragu. Related Link: Elon Musk

2020-12-26 17:00:36#tech#PC Gamer Hardware Awards: What is the best VR headset of 2020?#https://www.pcgamer.com/gear-of-the-year-2020-vr-headsets/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/sM4jPorkRUcQgfmFV7bKUZ-1200-80.jpg#sw#0.802#www.pcgamer.com#I've certainly wished to escape reality this year
column2: as have I imagine many of you.  Virtual reality has proven one such way to get outside
column3: abroad
column4: or just anywhere but your house for a moment or two.  From piloting a TIE Fighter in Star Wars: Squadrons
column5: battling the Combine in the stellar Half-Life: Alyx
column6: to clutching a flashlight for dear life in Phasmophobia
column7: I've said it before and I'll say it again: it's a great time to get into virtual reality. A big part of that is the sheer quantity and quality of VR headsets available today
column8: primed to plug into our gaming PCs and whisk us away to virtual worlds.  New arrivals have some big shoes to fill in 2020
column9: following in the footsteps of the Valve Index.  Yet we've seen at least one new challenger for the tethered VR crown in 2020: the HTC Vive Cosmos Elite. Towards the very tail-end of the year there was also the staggered arrival of the HP Reverb G2
column10: although with availability solely to those who pre-ordered in November
column11: and with little word on a public release
column12: we've not been able to consider it for this title fight.  The HP Reverb G2 is still in a sort of limbo between pre-order release and one to the public in earnest
column13: it seems.  Similarly
column14: Pimax released the 5K Super just before time.  This just goes to show how varied the VR headset market is nowadays—hardly the two-horse race it once was between HTC and Oculus. Speaking of Oculus
column15: this year also saw the arrival of the Oculus Quest 2.  Starting at $299
column16: it is the most affordable of the lot
column17: and even more so once you discount the need for a powerful PC with a VR-capable graphics card.  While not the usual fare we'd consider here at PC Gamer
column18: the Oculus Link functionality introduced with the initial Quest headset back in 2019 turns the Quest 2 into a thoroughly decent tethered headset with only a single USB Type-C cable. ##https://www.pcgamer.com/gear-of-the-year-2020-vr-headsets/

What Happened: EV publication Electrek has obtained an email sent by Musk to Tesla's employees.  In it
column4: he encourages them to ""go all out to make it happen
column5: referring to reaching 500
column6: 000 deliveries this year. ""All the critics who
column7: as recently as two years ago said that we'd never make it
column8: also called our target of half a million in 2020 'impossible. ' The heck with them
column9: we are doing it!"" Musk wrote. The car manufacturer founder is also asking Tesla's employees to make sure there are enough people at the ""end of the line"" to deliver the cars as fast as possible: ""Particular help would be appreciated at the end of the line to ensure cars built now are able to be delivered immediately without any further improvements in PDI
column10: as there simply isn't enough time to do so. "" PDI probably refers to pre-delivery inspection. What's Next: It is unclear how many vehicles are left to deliver to reach the milestone of 500
column11: 000 deliveries
column12: but Musk seems to believe the team can achieve it with just a few days left of the year. Investors seem to believe in Tesla
column13: with the stock reaching new highs after the company was added to the S&P 500 Index. Musk has previously asked the team to be careful with the investors' trust
column14: writing in an email on Dec.  1: ""Investors are giving us a lot of credit for future profits
column15: but if
column16: at any point
column17: they conclude that's not going to happen
column18: our stock will immediately get crushed like a souffle under a sledgehammer!""Price Action: Tesla shares closed 0. 27% lower
column19: at $660 in the after-hours trading session on Thursday. See more from Benzinga * Click here for options trades from Benzinga * Elon Musk Calls Bitcoin 'BS' In Tawdry Tweet

2020-12-25 12:48:17#entertainment#10 Best Albums of 2020: Taylor Swift
column2: Bob Dylan
column3: The Weeknd and More#https://www.msn.com/en-us/music/news/10-best-albums-of-2020-taylor-swift-bob-dylan-the-weeknd-and-more/ss-BB1ccMog#https://www.msn.com/en-us/music/news/10-best-albums-of-2020-taylor-swift-bob-dylan-the-weeknd-and-more/ss-BB1ccMog#sw#0.7184#www.msn.com#At a time of global unrest
column4: music artists across all genres provided much-needed escapes in 2020 with incredible albums that we have had on loop for months on end.  The year started off on a high note with new releases from Selena Gomez
column5: Halsey and Justin Bieber
column6: but it was not until mid-March
column7: when the COVID-19 pandemic ramped up
column8: that things really kicked into high gear in the music industry.  Just one week apart
column9: The Weeknd and Dua Lipa respectively dropped After Hours and Future Nostalgia
column10: two of the most critically acclaimed albums of the past 12 months.  “I’ve been a little bit conflicted about putting music out and
column11: you know
column12: whether it’s the right thing to do during this time because lots of people are suffering
column13: ” the “Don’t Start Now” singer admitted on Instagram Live at the time with tears in her eyes.  Ultimately
column14: Lipa decided that an upbeat dance album was just what the doctor (or at least her fans) ordered.  The risk paid off
column15: and she went on to score six Grammy nominations including Album of the Year.  One hitmaker who did not have any hesitations about releasing music during the pandemic was Taylor Swift.  In July
column16: she surprised her legion of fans with Folklore
column17: an album recorded entirely in quarantine with producers Jack Antonoff and Aaron Dessner.  Swifties were still busy dissecting each and every lyric from Folklore when the “Betty” songstress released its sister record
column18: Evermore
column19: less than five months later.  “To put it plainly
column20: we just couldn’t stop writing songs
column21: ” she explained via Instagram in December.  “To try and put it more poetically
column22: it feels like we were standing on the edge of the folklorian woods and had a choice: to turn and go back or to travel further into the forest of this music.  We chose to wander deeper in.  I’ve never done this before.  In the past I’ve always treated albums as one-off eras and moved onto planning the next one after an album was released. ” Swift continued
column23: “There was something different with folklore.  In making it
column24: I felt less like I was departing and more like I was returning.  I loved the escapism I found in these imaginary/not imaginary tales.  I loved the ways you welcomed the dreamscapes and tragedies and epic tales of love lost and found into your lives.  So I just kept writing them. ” Scroll down for Us Weekly’s list of the 10 best albums of 2020!##https://www.msn.com/en-us/music/news/10-best-albums-of-2020-taylor-swift-bob-dylan-the-weeknd-and-more/ss-BB1ccMog

column1: 2020-12-24 01:31:55#sport#Fisch wins the press conference; now
column2: he must win some games#http://allsportstucson.com/2020/12/23/fisch-wins-the-press-conference-now-he-must-win-some-games/#https://mlmga58ftpnz.i.optimole.com/vJTBr2A--fhy468-/w:auto/h:auto/q:auto/http://allsportstucson.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/fischmug.png#sw#0.8176#allsportstucson.com#"So
column3: how was your day? For University of Arizona athletic officials
column4: it was a great day to be a Wildcat in hiring who they think will bring back some respectability to the program.  For Jedd Fisch
column5: it was a great day to be named a head coach at the University of Arizona.  For the Arizona letter winners/former UA players
column6: it was a strange day of having been told one thing and delivered another.  New UA football coach Jedd Fisch For the Arizona the fan base
column7: it was a perplexing day of having to google the name Jedd Fisch to see who they'd be cheering for next season and why.  So
column8: to say it was a mixed bag of emotions in Wildcat Nation would be an understatement.  Arizona athletic director Dave Heeke said Fisch is the ""right man at the right time to rebuild and bring this program to prominence
column9: a proud program. "" He said they'll fall in love with his energy and genuineness.  And his commitment to UA.  ""We are excited about the future and we are excited about bringing championships to Arizona Stadium
column10: Arizona president Bobby Robbins said.  ""I'm particularly excited about the next chapter in University of Arizona football. "" Good luck with that.  https://youtu. be/vi6PVe1yk_o And I'm not saying that in a condescending way
column11: but a legitimate good luck way because the next two to three years are going to be one of the most unbelievable tasks in Arizona's recent history of college football.  He'll have to be a builder of a program many feel has hit rock bottom after the terrible hire of Kevin Sumlin.  Is Fisch the right guy to do it? Time will tell
column12: but Robbins and Heeke have gone all in with a man who has more stops and starts than a Greyhound bus.  But the two have brought on a coach – a 44-year-old good guy and family man – who has been through several college programs and through a number of NFL teams.  https://twitter. com/ArizonaFBall/status/1341810200009875457 Yes
column13: his resume is impressive.  It lacks one thing: head coaching experience.  Welcome to Arizona's Trial by Fire – the First Chapter.  It isn't going to be easy.  Without question
column14: he has great endorsements from Bill Belichick (his latest employer given he was the QB coach of the New England Patriots) and a former boss in Pete Carroll.  What employee wouldn't want those two as references? https://twitter. com/ArizonaFBall/status/1341837732755111937?s=20 Fisch had them.  Now he's on his own and must find some head coach magic to move forward at a program looking for any kind of hope or fortune to get back to UA's glory days of the
column15: um
column16: 1990s.  But more on that later.  He called being the head coach at UA ""the perfect opportunity"" and that he's ""extremely grateful"" for the chance at the job.  Oh
column17: by the way it will pay him more than $2 million a year.  He's now on the clock to make it all work.  If he'd like to tackle a couple of issues from the start
column18: it would be best to sooth the alumni and the former players who invested blood
column19: sweat and tears into the program (and time and effort in a Zoom call with Heeke last week)
column20: he can get some notable former players on his coaching staff.  Maybe he has already spoken to them.  Chuck Cecil? Ricky Hunley? Antoine Cason? Brandon Sanders? It could be an all-star lineup of former UA players with NFL pedigree.  Diversity is of importance
column21: he said.  ""We're going to be able to find some coaches that have coached or coach in the NFL
column22: Fisch said.  ""We're going to have some coaches that currently coach or have coached in the Pac-12 or in the Big 12 in the surrounding areas.  https://twitter. com/ArizonaFBall/status/1341887758151741442?s=20 ""We're going to find some coaches that have played in the National Football League.  We're going to find some coaches that have played at the University of Arizona or at other places across the country.  We're going to build a tremendous staff.  I feel very confident in that. "" Yes
column23: he won the press conference.  It wasn't 70-7 but a victory is a victory.  Now
column24: he must win over the letter winners who for all intents and purposes where told UA would get a guy who had some UA blood in him or some UA lineage or had some of those qualities.  Fisch wasn't that guy
column25: but he did speak to the ex-players in a Zoom call shortly before he spoke to the media.  He said it was a ""great meeting"" in as much as his message was relayed to them.  He knows their history.  He rattled off the coaches who have been here: Larry Smith
column26: Dick Tomey
column27: John Mackovic
column28: Mike Stoops
column29: Rich Rodriguez and Kevin Sumlin.  So
column30: there's that.  Heeke said Fisch realizes ""he needs to bridge that gap"" between the past and the present.  ""What I've asked them to do is to open up this forum and open up this relationship and welcome our family to Tucson in the same way that we want to welcome them into our building
column31: he said.  ""That our football facility and our practices are going to be open in the springtime.  We want people to watch us go.  We want our alumni
column32: and we want our fans and we want people to see what we do because I want everyone to understand how hard we're going to work
column33: how much we're going to try to get back to where it once was in 1998 when they were fourth in the country and 12-1.  ""I had an unbelievable conversation with Tedy Bruschi
column34: both last night and this morning
column35: and really understand where University of Arizona football was
column36: and really looking forward to trying to get it back to that place that nobody wanted to play Arizona football and were a team that played angry
column37: a team that played mad.  We were a team that played tough and we were a team that found a way to hold the team to 30 yards rushing per game
column38: which is about the craziest statistic I think I might have ever heard in the game of football. "" Here's another: Arizona is riding a 12-game losing streak and right now
column39: that's the most important thing that needs to be fixed.  We'll see about the honeymoon and we'll see about the progression.  Coach Fisch
column40: here's to you gaining a large School of Fisch fans because there have been a few coaches before you in the last 20 years that didn't do justice to the job. "##http://allsportstucson.com/2020/12/23/fisch-wins-the-press-conference-now-he-must-win-some-games/

column11: and secure browser

column21: it contributes to better use.  Moreover

column25: search suggestions
column26: history
column27: bookmarks
column28: etc.  Download Lighting Browser Ecosia https://youtu. be/yT6Ecl8KLbI Ecosia is an open-source browser that is committed to the environment since 80% of its income is used for planting trees

column31: downloads
column32: incognito mode to browse the web

Download DuckDuckGo Kiwi Browser Kiwi is an independent application based on Chromium.  Its interface is very similar to that of Google Chrome or Brave. column2: but Valve always squeezes in one last big sale to close out the year.  The Steam Winter sale is live now

column4: featuring some of the best games of the year and especially low prices on other games we recommend. Several of our 2020 Game of the Year picks are even on sale
column5: including Hades
column7: and Spelunky 2.  Our Game of the Year is on sale
column8: too
column9: but that one's staying a secret for another week!Below the 2020 games we've organized the deals into categories: $25
column11: and $5.  You might be surprised at a few of the discounts in there: The entire Deus Ex series is only $10
column12: while our favorite game of 2019
column13: Disco Elysium
column14: is on sale for 40 percent off.  Pick it up now

2020-12-19 17:48:48#entertainment#Sebastian Stan Might Have His Chance to Finally Play Luke Skywalker#https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/sebastian-stan-might-chance-finally-174848140.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/15MrsSCB2bkmhuNzGvtJLg--~B/aD00MDA7dz02MTg7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/thewrap.com/2f753c2d8e21ea1396511bd688d5dc7f#sw#0.5267#www.yahoo.com#"“The Mandalorian” surprised fans by bringing back Luke Skywalker in its second season finale.  The young Jedi showed up in a moment that was both exciting and heartbreaking — he saved Mando and Grogu from Moff Gideon but took Grogu from his adopted space dad.  We’re not sure what’s going to happen to Grogu in Season 3
column2: but we do know that we want to see more of Luke Skywalker. And while Mark Hamill obviously can’t play young Luke
column3: there is someone who can.  Someone who fans have been saying should play the character for years.  Someone who has even endorsed it himself. To put it plainly: cast Sebastian Stan as young Luke
column4: you cowards!MAJOR SPOILER ALERT!Someone should have told Jon Favreau that when they were making Chapter 16 of TheMandalorian
column5: they had Sebastian Stan as an option to play Luke Skywalker instead of using CGI.  Im not sure
column6: but I think @HamillHimself would have been ok with it as well.  pic. twitter. com/uzwbMGvdOy— Elijah Zuniga (@tallguy654) December 18
column7: 2020What a missed opportunity it was for Disney not to use their excellent connections to recast Sebastian Stan as Luke Skywalker StarWars Mandalorian pic. twitter. com/mEQGLlvqWb— Preston (@Champ__Brown) December 18
column8: 2020The resemblance of Stan to a young Hamill is pretty uncanny
column9: but that’s not the only reason fans have been calling for his involvement in “Star Wars. ” There’s pretty much a perfect storm of things that make him the absolute only choice if we were to ever get a young Luke in “The Mandalorian” or any other live-action “Star Wars” property. Also Read: This Famous Jedi Showed Up in 'The Mandalorian' and Fans Have Lost Their MindsAs the tweet says
column10: he’s much already primed for the role.  He’s an actor already working under the Disney umbrella with his Marvel films
column11: so it would be pretty easy to lure him to the Lucasfilm side.  (As Pixar just did with Chris Evans. ) And despite the fact that he’s just boarded a Hulu biopic to play Tommy Lee opposite Lily James’ Pamela Anderson
column12: his only current project is “The Falcon and the Winter Soldier
column13: ” which has already finished filming.  The third season of “The Mandalorian” probably wouldn’t start filming until sometime next year but
column14: either way
column15: that leaves a convenient slot of time available in terms of scheduling. Back in 2017
column16: at Rhode Island Comic Con
column17: Stan expressed interest in playing the role in a video that quickly went viral.  Of course
column18: one would think that Hamill might want to give his own approval when it comes to someone else taking over the iconic role in some capacity.  And he technically did
column19: making a tweet that joked
column20: “Sorry to disappoint you but I refuse to say ‘Sebastian Stan – I AM YOUR FATHER!’ (Even though
column21: in fact
column22: I am. )” Yes
column23: even Mark Hamill wants to see Sebastian Stan as Luke Skywalker.  And that’s a pretty big endorsement. Come on
column24: Disney! Give the people what they want!We’ll forgive “The Mandalorian” this one time for using CGI.  Maybe Stan wasn’t available or just couldn’t commit.  But basically
column25: if “The Mandalorian” is going to give us more Luke Skywalker
column26: just cast Stan and make everyone happy.  We guarantee that it’ll be the win that we all need in 2021. Sorry to disappoint you but I refuse to say ""Sebastian Stan-I AM YOUR FATHER!"" (even though
column27: in fact
column28: I am) 😜 SorryNotSorry MySonSebastian pic. twitter. com/A6e4t6GkXC— Mark Hamill (@HamillHimself) September 24
column29: 2017 Read original story Sebastian Stan Might Have His Chance to Finally Play Luke Skywalker At TheWrap"##https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/sebastian-stan-might-chance-finally-174848140.html

column1: 2020-12-16 15:36:29#business#Moderna Party Ending
column2: Analysts Caution Before Shot Approval#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/moderna-party-ending-analysts-caution-153629171.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/UjVwM0boh3tjcmMxaH0PyA--~B/aD02NzU7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_markets_842/9d7c068311d288c7e078e74aa5c8a3b9#sw#0.7003#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- Moderna Inc’s swift rise -- much of it driven by daytraders speculating over the chances of its Covid-19 vaccine getting approval -- is picking up more detractors on Wall Street by the day. Morgan Stanley is the latest to downgrade the stock after its 653% rally this year through Tuesday’s trading.  The bank expects the shares will be driven by “vaccine revenue realization
column3: vaccine competition and long-term Covid-19 revenue sustainability” over the next year or so. The stock fell as much as 8. 8% to $134. 31 per share at the open on Wednesday.  Moderna’s shot will face a Food and Drug Administration panel on Thursday
column4: and soon after the vaccine is likely to get regulatory clearance. Now is the time to step to the sidelines as investor expectations are “closer to the bull case than the bear case on Covid-19
column5: ” Morgan Stanley analysts led by Matthew Harrison wrote to clients
column6: cutting their rating to equal-weight from overweight. The bank’s 12-month price target was raised to $150 from $100
column7: which is below the biotech’s record closing price of $169. 86 reached earlier this month. Moderna’s valuation may be at risk if retail interest wanes as new vaccines become a reality.  Pfizer Inc.
column8: the other frontrunner in the search for a shot
column9: has sold off roughly 11% in the past six trading days.  Pfizer and its German partner BioNTech SE’s inoculation received an emergency use authorization at the end of last week. Morgan Stanley’s downgrade follows a similar warning from Jefferies analyst Michael Yee
column10: who cut his rating to hold from buy overnight citing the “significant stock run and elevated expectations. ” An analyst at Needham also cut his stock rating last Wednesday.  Moderna now has nine buys
column11: seven holds and two sell ratings
column12: according to data compiled by Bloomberg. The average analyst price target of $136 indicates there may be a little more downside to come before specialist investors can safely get back into the stock.  As one of the top biotech outperformers for the year
column13: Moderna is also a prime target for bears.  Close to $4 billion in shares are shorted
column14: according to financial analytics firm S3 Partners. For more articles like this
column15: please visit us at bloomberg. comSubscribe now to stay ahead with the most trusted business news source. ©2020 Bloomberg L. P. ##https://finance.yahoo.com/news/moderna-party-ending-analysts-caution-153629171.html

2020-12-15 23:49:22#tech#Cat café sim Calico is out right now
column2: thank goodness#https://www.pcgamer.com/cat-cafe-sim-calico-is-out-right-now-thank-goodness/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/aMECLcxFnAxtN8HLSKa6jn-1200-80.gif#sw#0.6705#www.pcgamer.com#"Everyone's a bit sick of hearing about how terrible 2020 has been
column3: so let's list some good things that have happened: cat café sim Calico is out.  That's all I've got.  We first heard about Calico back in early 2019
column4: and were immediately impressed that you can ride cats in it.  But this is no mere cat-racer
column5: it's a ""day-in-the-life community sim game"" about building and nurturing a rundown cat café.  This entails filling it with very nice cats
column6: but you'll also need to stock it with food and furniture
column7: I guess. Calico is played from a third-person perspective
column8: and you can design your own playable cat café hero.  You'll need to roam around town befriending and recruiting cats
column9: but there's also cooking to be done
column10: and potions to be decocted.  The Steam page notes that you can turn ""a single animal giant-sized"".  In real life
column11: I'm fairly sure cats would torture humans to death if they were giant
column12: but that doesn't appear to be the case in Calico
column13: thankfully. Lauren played an early build of Calico late last year
column14: writing that it's ""inspired by the mechanics of Animal Crossing and the aesthetic of Sailor Moon"".  Sounds good.  it's available now on Steam
column15: Epic
column16: and itch. io
column17: and there's a launch trailer below:"##https://www.pcgamer.com/cat-cafe-sim-calico-is-out-right-now-thank-goodness/
